5.3% at baseline to 6.5% at endline. 
In Zambia, the rate increased by 15%, from 
2.7% at baseline to 3.1% at endline (Figure 7).
Although Uganda’s rates fall within the 
optimal 5%  –  15% range,  Zambia’s rates remain 
lower than 5%. One challenge in Zambia has 
been a shortage of clinicians with surgical 
skills. However, improvements in transport and 
referral capabilities as part of the SMGL initiative 
helped increase access to neighboring district 
hospitals with obstetric surgical care,
